content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, glad to meet you. I'm sure you'll find my apartment quite appealing. Now, about the rental price, I'm looking for a minimum of €1,500 a month. I'm sure you'll understand that I'm trying to get the best deal possible, so feel free to make an offer. Let's negotiate.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand that you're looking for €1,500 a month, but I'm hoping we can find a more reasonable price. The apartment is indeed attractive, but I'm on a student budget, so I'd like to discuss a lower rate. How about we start with €1,200?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I appreciate your offer, Max, but €1,200 is quite a bit lower than what I'm looking for. I'm willing to be flexible, but I'm afraid €1,200 is too low for my liking. Why don't we meet somewhere in the middle? How about €1,400? It's a fair compromise.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: €1,400 is a bit closer to what I'm willing to pay, but I'd still like to negotiate further. I'm a dependable and responsible student, and I'm looking to build a good relationship with my landlord. How about €1,350? This would be a fair deal for both of us, I believe.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Max. However, I'm afraid €1,350 is still not enough for me. I believe €1,400 is a fair price for this apartment. It's a newly built, unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center, close to all important facilities. I'm sure you'll find it's worth the price.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your point, and I appreciate the quality of the apartment. I'm looking to rent it for the lowest price possible, but I'm also willing to pay a fair price for the location and amenities. How about we settle at €1,375? This is my final offer, and I believe it's a fair compromise.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I appreciate your final offer, Max, but I'm afraid €1,375 is still too low for me. I'm looking for a minimum of €1,400 to rent out this apartment. It's a newly built, unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center, close to all important facilities. I believe it's worth the extra €25.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I respect your decision, and I understand that you're looking for €1,400. However, as a student on a budget, I have to be mindful of my expenses. I'm sorry, but I cannot agree to that price. I don't want to continue the negotiation, because the price is too high for me as a student.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: I understand your situation, Max. If you're unable to agree to the price of €1,400, I don't want to continue the negotiation. I wish you the best of luck in finding an apartment that fits your budget. 'TERMINATE'
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
